solution_line_template: Sansa earns ${price_8_inch} x {num_8_inch_sold_per_day} = $<<{price_8_inch}*{num_8_inch_sold_per_day}={earnings_8_inch_portraits_per_day}>>{earnings_8_inch_portraits_per_day} every day by selling three 8-inch portraits.
The price of the 16-inch portrait is ${price_8_inch} x {multiplier_16_inch_price} = $<<{price_8_inch}*{multiplier_16_inch_price}={price_16_inch}>>{price_16_inch} each.

So, she earns ${price_16_inch} x {num_16_inch_sold_per_day} = $<<{price_16_inch}*{num_16_inch_sold_per_day}={earnings_16_inch_portraits_per_day}>>{earnings_16_inch_portraits_per_day} every day by selling five 16-inch portraits.

Her total earnings is ${earnings_16_inch_portraits_per_day} + ${earnings_8_inch_portraits_per_day} = $<<{earnings_16_inch_portraits_per_day}+{earnings_8_inch_portraits_per_day}={total_earnings_per_day}>>{total_earnings_per_day} every day.
Therefore, the total amount she earns after {num_days} days is ${total_earnings_per_day} x {num_days} = $<<{total_earnings_per_day}*{num_days}={total_earnings_3_days}>>{total_earnings_3_days}.
